newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds rise with U.S. Treauries.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds rise with U.S. Treauries.

text.p: Argentine bonds were higher in late morning trading Friday, boosted by strong gains in U.S. Treasuries after a benign U.S. January jobless report.
"The (jobless report) showed few inflationary signs," said a trader at a local bank. The U.S. 30-year yield was last nine basis points lower at 6.67 percent.
According to the U.S. Labor Department the economy added 271,000 non-farm jobs in January, higher than expected. But, at the same time the report showed a sharp drop in average weekly hours worked.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 was flat at 90-1/4, while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 rose $0.10 to 125.95.
Another trader suggested there was some caution because of the political crisis in Ecuador, where Congress decided to oust President Abdala Bucaram late Thursday.
"For now Ecuador is not affecting the market, but if the situation gets worse it could hit Latin American markets," said the trader.
